page.title: 01Cotherstone Moor
page.content: A mile to the SW of Cotherstone the moor rises gradually to the west, broken by a number of steep gullies with rock outcrops containing small drainage streams flowing eastwards. The area is covered with heather and coarse grass with bracken in the gullies. The sole habitation is Battle hill farm on the higher ground, and here, together with some of the lower slopes, the land is enclosed by dry stone walls and gives rough grazing for sheep and cattle. A minor road crosses NS over the moor connecting the villages of Bowes and Cotherstone. Clos to this on the west side is a firing range stretching westwards towards higher ground where there are a few isolated small plantations of mixed trees.Sheep roam at will over unenclosed areas.
